name: Obsidian Ophidian
movement: walk 30 ft., swims through lava effortlessly
description: The Obsidian Ophidian is a massive, serpentine elemental creature with a texture resembling glossy obsidian. It thrives in lava and has a fiery appearance, despite its dark stone-like body.
memorable: It can move through lava as if it were solid ground and can regenerate health when in contact with lava.
goals: To dominate its fiery territory and eliminate intruders.
relations: Often found near or within volcanic areas, frequently encountered with other elemental creatures.
environment: Typically found in volcanic regions and near molten lava.
strengths: Can traverse lava without harm, has regeneration abilities, and deals damage when taking bludgeoning damage.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to bludgeoning and cold damage, which can impede its regenerative abilities.
attacks: It can make multiple bite attacks or constrict enemies, and it can splash lava dealing fire damage to nearby creatures.
most_powerful_ability: Lava Splash allows it to deal significant fire damage to multiple targets at once.
senses: Possesses tremorsense up to 60 feet, allowing it to sense movement in its environment.
skills: Has proficiency in Perception, allowing it to detect nearby creatures with a decent level of awareness.
additional_information: Can sense creatures touching the same pool of lava it occupies.
Has condition immunities including exhaustion and paralysis.
Piercing damage from embedded shards of obsidian can continue even after initial wounds.
Can splash lava every few rounds to deal area damage.
Does not die until it starts its turn with 0 hit points.
test_queries: creature that thrives in molten lava
elemental that can regenerate in lava
fiery creature with piercing shards attack
